headline: JOA Air Solutions Launches Steam-Producing Heat Pump System for Industrial Drying at Philip Morris International's Bologna facility
summary: A state of the art heat recovery system coupled with a pioneering 139 °C steam producing heat pump has been commissioned by Philip Morris International (PMI) at their site in Bologna. The system is provided by Dutch System Integrator JOA Air Solutions using a high-temperature heat pump from German start-up, SPH. The pilot unit has shown capability to reduce the gas consumption for the main dryer by 40-50% in the last months of operation, the system also recovered 20-30% of water from the exhaust

thumbnail.caption: Steam‑producing heat pump at Philip Morris, integrated by JOA Air Solutions

headline: Philip Morris International Inc. (PM): A Bull Case Theory
summary: We came across a bullish thesis on Philip Morris International Inc. on Recital’s Substack by Anthony Yiu. In this article, we will summarize the bulls’ thesis on PM. Philip Morris International Inc.’s share was trading at $156.15 as of December 1st. PM’s trailing and forward P/E were 22.47 and 18.80 respectively according to Yahoo Finance. headline: Why Analysts Think Philip Morris Could Be Mispriced After Guidance Cut And Strong Q3 Results
summary: Philip Morris International's latest valuation update nudges its fair value estimate fractionally lower to about $182.94 per share, even as the underlying investment story remains in flux. Slight trims to long term revenue growth assumptions and a marginally lower discount rate reflect a nuanced balancing of stronger recent execution against lingering regulatory and category risks. Read on to see what is driving this shifting narrative and how you can stay on top of future updates as the...
